scenarioDescription:
The HD 164604 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 164604 is a star with 0.77 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 128.39 light years away from the solar system.

HD 164604 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 164604 system


HD 164604 b

HD 164604 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2010-03, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.33 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 164604 b is 635.339 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 164604 b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 164604 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 164604, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 164604 - System With 1 Exoplanet
